header.relationships: Close family, partners, very close friends
header.topics: Languages, GCSE course choices, mobile phones, fond memories of Dads/Granddads, books/films/TV.

so is it is it Maltese? is that the language?
do you so do you speak Maltese?
no we er er picked up odd words from going there because we'd go there every sort of two or three years as children and you know you learn yes no hello goodbye
and then some of the erm the food where there isn't a an English translation we would call it the the Maltese term
erm but so many people were w you know family and because everybody's your family everybody's related cos the island's so tiny
and they'd they'd say did your mum not teach you Maltese? and it'd be almost quite sort of shock horror
and then when my sisters and I were old enough one of them found a course at college a language course in Maltese so we all enrolled
but I think there were maybe six people so the four of us and two other random
people and there wasn't enough to to warrant running the course
but it's a really difficult langlanguage because it's it's erm it's a little bit sort of like it's not like Italian a lot of people think it will be

erm and a lot of the pronunciations of the letters are different as they are in in many other languages as well it's so difficult to read
but because it is a little country that's having to evolve with the whole of the rest of the world
